reviews.review: Beautiful game with a magnificent story. its fun to play, its good looking and the dlcs are wonderful

BioShock Infinite still holds up in my opinion. A lot of the criticism it has been getting lately is somewhat warranted, but none of those things actually ruined my experience of it. Having only two guns at a time never really bothered me, since I always have my favorites either way, though that is definitely a personal preference. The story is confusing yes, but I don't think it doesn't make sense at all either. I definitely didn't think the ending was rushed as some others think, since we've gotten so many hints throughout the game, from the very beginning. Some flaws in logic are to be expected though, from a story like this one. My biggest complaint is probably the weapon upgrade system, but having beaten it on hard difficulty, even that only became a real problem at the end, when I couldn't refill my favorite guns with ammo anymore. Otherwise, I think it's still a great game, and worth playing, if you haven't played it yet.

Bioshock Infinite is almost as good as the first game in my opinion.

The art style and setting of this game completely changes in direction, putting you in a floating city and having the art style go in a lot more stylized and less realistic direction, while still having the steampunk aesthetic. The game also introduces some really fun mechanics, such as the sky hooks, which I think were executed very well. As for the story, it can get pretty convoluted at times but if you are willing to sit through it all I think it is worth it as the story is one of the best I've seen in a video game ever. That said, Elizabeth can get pretty annoying at times (there is one section that is particularly frustrating, but I won't spoil.) In my opinion, the game can also get frustratingly hard on some boss fights if you are not on easy mode. But most of the issues are small enough to ignore.

This game is fantastic. The awe never stops, from the moment you launch the game, til the moment you complete it. This is by far the best FPS ever made. Words cannot express this game. It has to be played.
The creativity behind this game, infact the entire franchise is remarkable. WOW

Game Direction: 8/10
Art Direction: 9.5/10
Narrative: 9.0/10
Technology (relative to its time): 9.5/10
Audio: 9.5/10
Overall score: 9.5/10

There are already many great reviews dissecting its complex narrative structure, and the game surely is rich with vast lore, interesting characters, mesmerising art directions and beautiful music, all helping to tell an intricate story that transcends time and space. 

The game also has many underlying themes, one of which is atonement. See, on the surface, the game may seem to be anti-christian, or even anti-religion, with one of the main antagonist being a cult leader and a fanatic. At least that how I felt when I did my first playthrough, seeing how the zealous minds were destroying humanity. But when I reached the end, I began to realise that this game was far more biblical than I had thought. It discusses what it truly means to atone for your sins, and the sacrifice that has to come with it. Only then, can you be "reborn". Its story parallels the journey of the Christ, "to be crucified and rise again", and draws influence from the famous "Crime and Punishment", just like its predecessor Bioshock 1. 

Overall, this is an excellent game, one of the few FPS campaigns that makes me want to play it again. I have not yet played Burial at Sea, but I'm certainly excited to see what comes next.

This is a really good game. The main asset here is the story, which is really stunning and makes you think. And that, to me, is what a really good game can do. Content that makes you think about your experiences. 

The game falls down on some gameplay elements and moment-to-moment action. There are too many stretches of defense in 3 waves, our princess is a tower in other scenarios, etc, and most of the heavy gunfights come mid-game. Throughout the middle it's a constant stream of room to room fights, which gets tedious, but the controls are solid enough and the weapons are enjoyable enough that it never spoils the game.

The voice and writing performances here are simply top notch, and not just from the main cast.

That being said, this is one of those games that will leave you thinking, contemplating, and trying to wrap your mind around the ideas and story elements the game just unleashed on you. It's an emotional story and the characters are relatable enough to make you like them. Solid 9/10
very nice gameplay but very deep scenario

Welp, it's been almost 10 years and I still remember that this was supposed to be much more than what we got. The reviews are glowing possitive though so either people stopped giving a shit long ago like I did and forgave it or plain forgot. Or more likely people stopped treating it like what it's title says it is; Bioshock, and rate it based on what it is: A pretty to look at, mutant bastard offshoot of a faithful reimagining that was simplified and trimmed of all but the essential fats and and given a family name instead of making up its own.

My first playthrough back at release, I remeber being grumpy and just rushing through it after realising what I was in for so most of it's a blur. The only things I managed to remember was heavenly americana late 1800's city, time period apropriate racism and labour laws representation and oddly missing sexism; female soldiers and swimsuits less modest than than their hubbies? Not 'til the day I see you vote let alone carry your own coin purse, dear.

My second playthrough, now 8 years later. I took my time, ate every snack, opened every thing that could, noticed Elizabeth scatman spaz out and teleport around enough times to just start justifying it with; It's her time and space powers so there's about a 100 of her with me at all times. My overall expierience was just as bland and forgetable as then.

Lame, but knowing they had to cut back on so much content and gameplay. What we got is...A mediocre action shooter with rigid and minimal impact arena resource manipulation: Weapons, meds and turrets instead of saaaaay a train, crowd or  a path like we see Elizabeth do in non-combat scripted scenes.

The rushed pace of the story really kicks you in the groin if you have a love for multiverse/time travel story telling. It flashes  quite a few cool things that the..ummm, genre(?)....has, but leaves it at that or plain disregards it like they do all of main cast. The story uses too many instruments and skips far too many notes to be forgiveably good. It's a passable story not because it shows or tells it to you, but because you already know what it's trying to tell you by knowing the genre and thus filling its blanks for it.
dios mio que buen puto juego, es buenisimo jueguenlo

Bioshock infinite es un spin-off de la saga Bioshock, en esta entrega nos adentr√°remos en una ciudad en las nubes, con un nuevo protagonista y una trama que se entrelaza con las anteriores. 

Lo Bueno 
Su trama: Infinite cuenta con un nuevo protagonista, nuevos personajes, un nuevo escenario y una nueva trama que se va desarrollando a medida que pasa el tiempo, es una narrativa muy bien elaborada con sus puntos positivos y negativos. En la cual con sus DLC logra tener ese mayor impacto entrelazando con sus entregas anteriores y logrando un gran final para esta saga.
La Ambientaci√≥n: Rapture presentaba una atmosfera fr√≠a, desolada y oscura en cambio Columbia es todo lo contrario, es alegre, colorida, te da la sensaci√≥n que nada malo puede suceder, y tiene su gran encanto en mi opini√≥n personal me gusto m√°s esta ciudad que la de Rapture, sus escenarios tienen un estilo de los a√±os 80 mezclado con una artictectura francesa.
Elisabeth: De algo que carec√≠a las entregas anteriores era la de presentar personajes entra√±ables, la mayor√≠a eran bastante simples sin mucha profundidad, pero en esta entrega cambia, conocemos a Elisabeth una joven la cual no va a estar acompa√±ando durante todo el viaje, y de que nos vamos a encari√±ar, tiene aquella profundidad para interesarnos en ella, adem√°s cuanta con una personalidad muy encantadora y aquella inocencia de una ni√±a.
Gamplay: Su gamplay fue completamente mejorado, en los primeros juegos se sent√≠a un tanto tosco y lento tambi√©n puede ser por el pasar de los a√±os, pero en este juego lo renovaron bastante es mucho m√°s r√°pido, el usar las armas y los poderes se siente mucho mejor, entre otras mejoras m√°s.

Lo Meh
Banda sonora: La m√∫sica y los efectos que posee son bastante normales, no te deja tampoco queriendo descargar su m√∫sica, lo que si el doblaje de vos me gust√≥ mucho.

Lo Malo 
Su gran complejidad en la trama: En mi ocasi√≥n me jugu√© los 3 juegos seguidos, me terminaba uno e iba al siguiente, y algo que me cost√≥ bastante es lograr entender su trama correctamente, presenta una trama muy profunda demasiado en algunos aspectos lo cual no est√° mal, pero siento que a veces te podes lograr perder incluso si estas presentando atenci√≥n a la misma durante todo el tiempo, al final para lograrla entenderla bien tuve que acudir a ver unos videos en YouTube.

Opini√≥n
Es una saga la cual me ha gustado mucho jugarla, teniendo una hermosa ambientaci√≥n, que es lo que m√°s me ha gustado y una trama muy profunda y bastante buena.

Historia: 9/10
Gamplay: 8/10
Apartado t√©cnico: 9/10
Ambientaci√≥n: 10/10
Optimizaci√≥n: 8/10
Valoraci√≥n: 9,3/10
